body.p: IAS 20 requires that government grants should not be recognised until there is reasonable assurance that:

li.p: the entity will comply with the conditions attaching to them; and

body.p: IAS 20 also requires that government grants should be recognised as income over the periods necessary to match them with the related costs that they are intended to compensate, on a systematic basis. In relation to the presentation of government grants related to assets, IAS 20 permits two methods—setting up a government grant as deferred income or deducting the government grant from the carrying amount of the asset.
